channel.title: Regression to the Mean on The Biology Reproducibility Project
channel.description: Recent content in Regression to the Mean on The Biology Reproducibility Project

item.title: Data from: Success despite the stress -- violet-green swallows increase glucocorticoids and maintain reproductive output despite experimental increases in flight costs
item.description: Sources Background Reproducibility key Caveats Data Reproducibility Initial measures Change in Cort Change in Body Mass Post-publication review “no significant differences” among treatment groups at baseline does not protect in any way against the bias in change scores (post - pre treatment measure) Estimates of treatment effects on Cortisol and Mass were not adjusted for baseline values Simulation to explore behavior in lmm vs. ANCOVA-lm vs. cLDA Adjustment for baseline comparing \(Cort_b\) Sources Rivers JW, Newberry GN, Schwarz CJ, Ardia DR (2017) Success despite the stress: violet-green swallows increase glucocorticoids and maintain reproductive output despite experimental increases in flight costs.
